thing-type.label: FGSD002 Smoke Detector
thing-type.description: Smoke Detector<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe Fibaro Smoke Sensor is a universal, optical Z-Wave smoke detector. Fire alarm is signaled by sound, visual indicator blinking and by sending Z-Wave alarm and control commands.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ul&gt<li&gtInstall the battery. Visual indicator will signal the Z-Wave network inclusion status (red - device ready for inclusion, green - device included, remove firstly - see p. II).</li&gt <li&gtMake sure the device is located within direct range of the Z-Wave controller.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller into the learning mode (see main controller’s operating manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, triple click the B-button, located on Fibaro Smoke Sensor’s casing.</li&gt <li&gtFibaro Smoke Sensor will be detected and included in the Z-Wave network</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ul&gt<li&gtMake sure the sensor is connected to battery.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller into the learning mode (see main controller’s operating manual)</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, triple click the B-button, located on Fibaro Smoke Sensor’s casing.</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtClick the B-button once to wakeup the device. Minimum wake-interval accepted by the device is 4200.</p&gt

parameter.description: There are 3 levels of sensitivity to smoke presence.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtLevel 1 means the highest sensitivity. Rising the parameter value lowers the sensitivity to smoke presence.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 10: Config of control frames in BASIC command class
parameter.description: This parameter defines which frames will be sent ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtin the 2-nd Association Group (FIRE ALARM). The values of BASIC ON and BASIC OFF frames may be defined as described in further parameters.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: BASIC ON and BASIC OFF enabled

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: BASIC ON frame value
parameter.description: BASIC ON frame is sent in case of smoke presence detection ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtand FIRE ALARM triggering. Its value is defined by the parameter. Available settings: 0-99, 255. 0 - turn off the device. 1-99 - set the device to 1-99%. 255 - set the last status</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: BASIC OFF frame value

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: Alarm broadcast

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode
parameter.description: Associations in Z-Wave network security mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtParameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2=3 means that 2nd &amp; 3rd group are sent as secure.</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It doesn’t apply to 1st Lifeline group.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_2
parameter.label: 20: Temperature report interval
parameter.description: Time interval between consecutive temperature reports.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtReport is sent when new temperature value is different from the one previously reported - according to the set hysteresis (parameter 21). Temperature reports can be also sent as a result of polling.<br /&gt</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 0, 1-8640 (multiply by 10 seconds) [10s-24h]<br /&gt</p&gt <p&gt0 – reports inactive<br /&gt1-8640 - [10s-24h]<br /&gt</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 1 (10 seconds)<br /&gtParameter size: 2 [bytes] </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Temperature report hysteresis
parameter.description: The temperature report will only be sent if there is a difference ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtin temperature value from the previous value reported, defined in this parameter (hysteresis). Temperature reports can be also sent as a result of polling.<br /&gt</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 1 – 100 (in 0,1oC steps)<br /&gt1-100 - (multiply by 0,1) [0,1oC - 10oC]<br /&gt</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 10 (1oC)<br /&gtParameter size: 1 [byte] </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_1
parameter.label: 30: Temperature threshold
parameter.description: Temperature threshold for activating alarms<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis is the temperature threshold, measured by the internal sensor above which the excess temperature notification is sent (visual indication/sound/Z-Wave report).</p&gt <p&gtNote that the alarm will not be deactivated again until the temperature drops by at least 2 degrees below this threshold.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_31_2
parameter.label: 31: Excess temperature signaling interval
parameter.description: Time interval of signaling (visual indication/sound) excess ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt temperature level</p&gt <p&gt<br /&gtAvailable settings: 1-8640 (multiply by 10 seconds) [10s-24h]<br /&gt1-8640 - [10s-24h]<br /&gt</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 1 (10 seconds)<br /&gtParameter size: 2 [bytes] </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_32_2
parameter.label: 32: Lack of Z-Wave range indication interval
parameter.description: Time interval of signaling (visual indication/sound) lack of ...<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtZ-Wave range.</p&gt <p&gt<br /&gtAvailable settings: 1-8640 (multiply by 10 seconds) [10s-24h]<br /&gt1-8640 - [10s-24h]<br /&gt</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 180 (30min)<br /&gtParameter size: 2 [bytes] </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Smoke Alarm
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSending the BASIC SET control command once smoke is detected. Its value may be modified in advanced parameters. Group may control up to five on/off devices.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Tamper Alarm TYPE = BURGLAR, EVENT
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSending the notification NOTIFICATION REPORT (TYPE = BURGLAR, EVENT = PRODUCT COVERING REMOVED) to associated devices once casing opening is detected. Up to five devices supporting casing opening command (NOTIFICATION REPORT) may be included in this group.</p&gt

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: Fire Alarm
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSending the notification SENSOR ALARM REPORT (TYPE= SMOKE ALARM) to associated devices once smoke is detected. Up to five devices supporting SMOKE ALARM command may be included in this group</p&gt

parameter.name: group_5
parameter.label: 5: Tamper Alarm TYPE = GENERAL
parameter.description: <br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtSending SENSOR ALARM REPORT notification (TYPE = GENERAL) to associated devices once casing opening is detected. Up to five devices supporting SENSOR ALARM REPORT command may be included in this group.</p&gt
